content.description:
To the right of "Best Laid Plans". Traverses right over the water up the diagonal finger of rock to the chains. First bolt is a little high, but solid holds throughout. Staying to the left of the bolts drops the grade to 10a/b. Stay on the right for some pumpy 10d moves. Crux between 3rd and 4th bolt.

Use the decent chains in the chute to prevent the rope from going in the water when pulling. Don't steal the carabiners!
content.location: Left of main Ghetto Wall, to the right of 'Best Laid Plans'.

content.description: Very short crux section. A few moves through superb pockets and pinches to jugs at the top. Have fun and try the alternate start jumping off the boulder and grabbing the shelf at the bottom.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the last cave on the Ghetto. Jugs to the lip down low or just start from the lip/shelf.

content.description:
A mediocre route up the usual Malibu pockets.  The route also climbs over one of the many cesspools, with the value added benefit of possibly getting your rope wet when you pull the line.  Great for rope biters, the flavors are magnificent.

Start by traversing left off a boulder at the base and getting up to the first bolt (the line straight up is for Junk Ramp 5.9).  Then follow up over a small bulge on a few directional holds that really arent as good as one would expect at the grade, eventually onto juggy pockets to the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts and clips at the anchors.
content.location:
Far right side of the main face, starts on the right side of the small pool below

Urban Struggle

, finishing on the same anchors.

content.description: Start by climbing up about 10 feet past a large hueco below the roof.  Pull the roof with more huecos, tricky movement, and some weight shifting and then climb diagonally up and right on much easier climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Located at the left side of the Ghetto Wall.  Route is to the right of Best Laid Plans and the tree.  Left of Wet Willy and the large chimney.

content.description:
Start of the route is found in the 3rd cave, right of Johnny Can't Lead. Climb to the obvious blocky feature, clip the 3rd draw, and move into the crux. A V9/10 boulder problem that revolves (literally) around a knee bar and a bad pinch ends with a dyno to a pocket/sloper - take your pick. Continue through the cruxes of Stink Finger and Urban Struggle.

Clipping the 4th bolt before completing the crux is difficult, and a fall here means decking potential. Bring the most competent belayer you can find.
content.location: This route starts in the 3rd cave of the Ghetto sector. Find the good holds about 6' right of Johny Can't Lead.

climbs.name: Suburban Struggle
climbs.fa: Adam Paz and I'm sure many before me

content.description: A variation of urban struggle and due to the lack of protection between bolt 3 and 5 should only do TR.  It basically is a way around the crux of Urban struggle. There is a slight crux as you start heading left to meet urban Struggle. Its in one of the guide books but I guess since this area is a total sport rock someone doesn't think it should be added? IDK in case you're like me and don't mind TR when routes are too hard but still want some challenge here it is
content.protection: TR only unless you feel dangerous due to not being a bolt where a #4 should be.
content.location: It starts and ends like Urban Struggle but you can follow a right variation to avoid the crux but its pretty tricky in itself.  you head right after the 3rd bolt

content.description: A pocket has broken making this climb harder than the original grade of 12d. But is still a solid line. Use the arete thing in the beginning and I suggest clipping the second bolt from one of the arete underclings.
content.protection: 3 bolts with chain anchors and carabiners
content.location: Start on the arete thing on the right side of the first big cave at the Ghetto. Soon after clipping the second bolt role left and out of the arete and make a hard move to the good pocket up and left. Clip the left perma draw and continue left and up to the Kathmandu anchors

content.description: A nice line connecting the cruxes of Hole patrol and Urban struggle. Go straight up to the huecoish hole then go up and left through the overhang. continue on some burly moves and continue into Urban Struggle and do the big left hand crux move of Urban. Finish on urban. It's a bit run out between the 3rd and 4th bolts.
content.location: Start on Hole Patrol and at the 3rd bolt go up and right connecting with Urban struggle. On the right side of the second cave at the ghetto wall.

content.description: Good fun movement, overhanging climbing on huecos and pockets to a one move crux up high. Don't forget the dropknee rest in the largest hueco!
content.location: At the very left side of the area first route left of Kathmandu

content.description: Climbs up and through the big pod at the far left of the wall.

Climb the right arete of the cave on small edges and sidepulls before turning a bulge. From here follow large huecos to anchors on the ledge above.

Challenge: Don't get your rope wet
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors on the ledge
content.location: On the opposite side of the creek from the ghetto. The small cave is right before the second traverse.

content.description: A direct start to Ghetto Crossing. Used to be 13a but a pocket has broken and the climb requires a huge lockoff off a crimp to a far left hand pocket.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with caribiners.
content.location: Start on the right side of the first big cave at the ghetto. Climb up the arete thing and clip two bolts to the left. Role left out of the arete to the fifth draw of Ghetto Crossing. Finish on Ghetto crossing.

content.description: Starts up the vertical vein of pockets 15 feet left of Skeezer Pleaser.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a double biner anchor.

content.description:
Start just inside the left side of the cave on a rock that's in the water. (right of Kathmandu). Climbs up, then through the center of the cave doing cryptic moves to an outrageous move to a two finger pocket. Then at the 4th bolt continue right on Ghetto Crossing and finishing at its anchors.

7 bolts, extending the 3rd bolt helps. Hard for the grade.

The route was originally tried from deep within the cave but since the climbing was not very challenging (and a bit chossy), the direct start was used for the first ascent. As far as I know, the deep start has not yet been red pointed.
Head up the left-most line of jugs on the vertical wall (5.9) and then move left through the giant dish and another bolt to the anchors.  Short but sequency crux.
content.location:
In the small alcove directly across from the Ghetto Wall, just after the traverse.  There are three small routes here on mediocre rock.  Nothing interesting but perhaps worth jumping on while waiting for crowds across the pond.

This is the left most of the three routes.

content.description: Large easy to find holds to a two bolt anchor. Quite overhung.
content.location: left side of the first cave

content.description: Same start as Urban Sprawl: couple moves left off the boulder then head straight up. Crux is before the first clip which is a bit high. Don't miss the third clip to the right. Run out 5.3 scrambling to the anchors.
content.location: Boulder at the far right edge of the main wall. Between Urban Sprawl and Ghetto Blaster.

content.description: Follows the line of large pockets between the right two caves. Very solid 5.10d. Last moves are beta intensive

start as for urban struggle except after the first bolt move up and left on undercling jugs. A long move gets you to 3 holes and the crux. Core up and pull the next big move, then move up and left to join up with johnny can't lead.
content.protection: 5 bolts (with option for 6 with increased rope drag)  to 3 bolt anchor
content.location: Ghetto wall. start as for urban struggle

content.description: Dead point to a tricky sequence.
content.location: around the corner from ghetto blaster

content.description: Route shares first two bolts with Katmandu and then follows bolt line to the right just above cave and finishes to anchors up right.

Start on thin pockets clip first bolt from juggy undercling, from here move right then up on shallow sloping pockets till you become level with a red streak at which point move left, rest on the good holds then make a very dynamic move back right, clip the last bolt then head for the crux, undercling the two finger pocket with the left hand and bump the right hand on bad pinches then throw for the lip with your left, end with the scary mantle to to reach the anchors.
content.location: Around the corner from Urban Struggle, starts just to the right of the arete on shallow pockets.

content.description: A direct finish to Kathmandu, at the third bolt head left then continue up the steep face using small pockets, hard pulling.
content.protection: The old anchors are gone. Now 8-9 draws are needed, depending on if you clip the last one of Kathmandu, plus 3 fixed chain draws to the anchor.

content.description: Named in remembrance of John Yablonski's suicide, this route climbs up and right, diagonally. The original line stayed low but most people climb a higher line with the bolts feeling a little low.
Short and unmemorable, but decent rock for the area.  5.9 pocket pulling leads to a small roof.  Ok to do if you're waiting for a route on Ghetto Wall or perhaps a mild warmup.
content.location:
In the small alcove directly across from the Ghetto Wall, just after the traverse.  There are three small routes here on mediocre rock.  Nothing interesting but perhaps worth jumping on while waiting for crowds across the pond.

This is the first route on the right.

content.description: Up the heavily pocketed vertical face (5.9) and then a short crux through a crack weakness in the roof. The crack seeps and the rock quality is not so good.
content.location:
In the small alcove directly across from the Ghetto Wall, just after the traverse.  There are three small routes here on mediocre rock.  Nothing interesting but perhaps worth jumping on while waiting for crowds across the pond.

This is the center route.

content.description: The route behind Ghetto blaster that goes up the ramp.  Finishes on Ground Zero's anchors.  Dirty with one fun section at the top from last bolt to anchors.  Crux is the start then its easy climbing up.
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts, have someone follow to clean.
content.location: between ghetto blaster and ground zero

content.description: Interesting route in the trees. Hard move at 7th bolt and crux after 8th. Run to anchor, but easy.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a double biner lower off.
content.location: Starts 15 feet right of Ground Zero. You can start at ground level, but you risk hitting a boulder behind you if a hold were to break. You can also scramble up around the right side of the boulder to its top and start by clipping the third bolt. Has been done from the ground many times without incident.

content.description: AKA Ghetto Crossing Directe. Start on the jugs of Kathmandu for two bolts. Tread a tad up and right to the 3rd bolt(only Ghetto Crossing and this route use this bolt. not same as kathmandu 3rd bolt). Traverse right on a couple good pocket to the 4th bolt in the big hueco thing. From here go straight up pulling through some v4ish pocket moves to the anchors. Same anchors as Kathmandu
content.protection: 5 bolts to chain anchors with carabiners
content.location: Left side of the big first cave at the Ghetto wall.

content.description: Do the v10 crux of Lateralus but go straight up. Start Lateralus and at the 4th bolt go direct and finish on the Katmandu anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts with chain anchors and carabiners
content.location: Left side of the first cave at the Ghetto Wall.

content.description: Best Laid Plans begins below a bulge, on pockets, and moves up and right around the bulge on large cavernous pockets. Above the bulge move left onto the featured face on crimps and shallow pockets.
content.location: Just downstream from the Ghetto rock pool, on the left (south) side of the stream near the large Sycamore tree.
